quotes.quote: Among the delights of Summer were picnics to the woods.
A picnic is more than eating a meal, it is a pleasurable state of mind.
Unless you are at a picnic, life is no picnic.
The examined life is no picnic.

The things that make me happiest in the whole world are going on the occasional picnic, either with my children or with my partner; big family gatherings; and being able to go to the grocery store - if I can get those things in, I'm doing good.
If the rain spoils our picnic, but saves a farmer's crop, who are we to say it shouldn't rain?
I've liked lots of people 'til I went on a picnic jaunt with them.
There's something so intimate about a picnic with your guy. And as the temperature begins to rise, eating outside becomes refreshing and romantic.
My perfect day would be to go on a picnic up Mt. Wilson with Christopher Isherwood, Greta Garbo, Aldous Huxley, and Bertrand Russell.

People don’t want to go to the dump and have a picnic, they want to go out to a beautiful place and enjoy their day. And so I think our job is to try to take the environment, take what the good Lord has given us, and expand upon it or enhance it, without destroying it.
There are few things so pleasant as a picnic lunch eaten in perfect comfort.
Things taste better outdoors. And if it's a forbidden thing, so much the better.
Picnics are very dear to those who are in the first stage of the tender passion.
Tea to the English is really a picnic indoors.
Anyone who thinks that the climbing of Denali is a picnic is badly mistaken.
You bring your own weather to the picnic.
One compensation of old age is that it excuses you from picnics.
